name: Empire Landmark Hotel and Conference Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Okay, first the positives: located right on Robson St near Denman, you are right in the heart of Vancouver and walking distance to many attractions. Secondly, the price was excellent - I think we paid about $125/night, using the hotel's own website. And parking is reasonable. I don't remember the exact cost, but it was much less than the $35 or so that most others charge. Finally, I don't think that there is a room with a bad view. We were on the 31st floor and had a great view of English Bay and Stanley Park. We checked out one night before a fireworks display, and we would have had an outstanding view.
reviews.title: Superb Location and Outstanding Value, but could use a Makeover

reviews.text: So what's wrong? For one, the rooms are rather small. Not that you need a lot of space, but there isn't much space to be had. Bed, bathroom, small worktable, and balcony. Secondly, while the rooms are not dirty or uncomfortable, just worn. The hotel could really benefit by a makeover. And not to nitpick, but the fitness facility only had a few cardio machines, and one of them wasn't working.
reviews.title: Incredible views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As with everything, you get what you pay for...and for what you pay you get a decent room in an excellent location, and if you don't mind a smaller room that is somewhat worn, you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Excellent Value, Excellent Hotel
Great Location
reviews.text: Nice hotel. But the two biggest assets are the reasonable rates, and the incredible views, especially from the side facing English Bay. The revolving restaurant has a stunning view. The area (Rabson Street) is also quite nice for eating.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very impressed with the hotel. It has a fabulous location on Robson St which is the commercial central of downtown Vancouver. It is a close walk to Stanley Park which boasts the Seawall, Horse carriage tour, Aquarium (all must do activities while in Vancouver).
reviews.title: Great location, terrific view, grumpy staff

reviews.text: This was my 3rd trip to Vancouver and decided we wanted to stay close to Stanley park and the other end of town to explore more of what it has to offer.
reviews.title: Good location but old hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we checked in there was only one check in agent who was rather slow and the line was very long. It took ages to be checked in and sent to our room.
reviews.title: Great Location, bad hotel

reviews.text: Our room was on the 35th floor and the lifts worked really well not much waiting around. The room is dated and the beds were hard and you only got 1 pillow on each bed (we stayed in a twin room) I have never seen that before in a hotel. The rooms were clean (except for one window of the room that had the blinds pulled over it and was never opened) and the view was really nice over the water from the balcony however the bathroom was rather small and very old.
reviews.title: Start of vacation

reviews.text: There was a fridge in the room which was good and also the towels were really soft for a hotel which I like.
reviews.title: Great location but shabby hotel with rude front desk staff

reviews.text: We did go to the hotel on level 42 for breakfast, it was decently priced with great views but I did not really like all of the food.
reviews.title: Never been treated so poorly by staff

reviews.text: This hotel is a great choice for anyone who wants to be in the heart if downtown at an economical price. We arrived early for our check in time and the friendly staff got us into a room right away. The room was very small and dated but it was very clean.Our room had a balcony which gave us very pretty city views. It is located in the heart of downtown Vancouver we were able to walk to the beach and trendy shopping and trendy restaurants in Denman street.Overall a very pleasant stay if you want a basic room with a great location for a great price this is a good choice.
reviews.title: Great downtown location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The receptionist allowed me to check in a little early which was nice. The room itself was basically furnished and clean, nothing special. While the view was very nice, the windows were very dirty. The building feels that it may have once housed a high end hotel, but the current operators do not keep it up to date or invest in costly maintenance (like window cleaning).
reviews.title: Great view but everything else was just average

reviews.text: In the morning, I was woken very early by knocking at the door by a staff member who insisted I had called downstairs for assistance (which I had not). A little while later, I was woken up again by the same man who had a hairdryer for me (which I did not request). The service was friendly, but a little disorganized.
reviews.title: A place to stay, to base, to view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I got a special rate from Hotwire of $100. At this price, it is a great deal with the view and excellent location. But I would not pay their full rates of $175+ for what is essentially a budget hotel.
reviews.title: Noisy hotel, poorly managed

reviews.text: My room was too small for the money. It could have used a bit of renovation. I could have done without the tour bus crowds from lands where revolving doors and electronic locks and elevators are a rarity.
reviews.title: Excellent location at affordable price
Coveniently located for cruise
reviews.text: Our view was outstanding in the upper story. Although plain and clean, this room served our purpose as an overnight stay before a cruise. Utilitarian with a great shower water pressure.Nothing fancy but we didn't care. Within walking distance to many dining choices. (Joe Forte was ours.)

reviews.title: nice place
reviews.text: The was a nice stop for 1 night after our cruise it was a place to get reorganized after 2 hours finding luggage and the line for a cab took forever. Set back and relax, was able to clean a few clothes.  Traveled with elder parents service was great, got to our room early.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It would be better if the hotel had a upgrade to room just stuffy.
reviews.title: Great Location!
